result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Allison E Kawalec

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Allison E Kawalec appeared by video.  Attorney Kendrick Yandell appeared by video for Allison E Kawalec.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Victim appeared via zoom. Status conference held. Defense is requesting additional time to review case. Case is adjourned in Branch 30.
Status conference scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Allison E Kawalec appeared by video.  Attorney Melissa Ivens appeared by video for Allison E Kawalec.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense counsel has not received discovery and has recently received an offer and requests additional time to review. 
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 30.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/bd44015b-7d6e-cd65-68a6-83d12d8964a7
Status conference scheduled for November 3, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 087259,
Payable Number: 1031746,
Receipt Number: 22RP036664,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Allison E Kawalec appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Defendant does not have an attorney. Discussion held. Defendant referred to State Public Defender's Office for more information.
Case adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with KLT.

Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 30.

Defendant Allison E Kawalec in court.  Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Allison E Kawalec not in court.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/23/2022@2:30p
